titles.title: To require the appropriate Federal banking agencies to increase the risk-sensitivity of the capital treatment of certain centrally cleared exchange-listed options and derivatives, and for other purposes.
To require the appropriate Federal banking agencies to increase the risk-sensitivity of the capital treatment of certain centrally cleared options, and for other purposes.
Options Markets Stability Act
Options Markets Stability Act
Options Markets Stability Act
Options Markets Stability Act

Options Markets Stability Act
Options Markets Stability Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 54 - 0.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-810.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 629.

action.text: Mr. Huizenga moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5749.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 385 - 0 (Roll no. 315).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
Options Markets Stability Act
This bill revises the method of calculating the risk, for purposes of satisfying capital rules applicable to depository institutions and depository institution holding companies, of certain options cleared through a central counterparty.
